page.title: 17Kirkhills Farm Whitehills
page.content: I have been farming for 19 years and was born in the house where I now live, although this has been greatly extended. {The recent pattern in agriculture has {seen farms increasing steadily in size to enable use of larger machinery and maximise output. When I took over Kirkhills it was {13 acres}, a croft rather than a farm. Now it extends to{ {440 acres,}248 in and around the village of Whitehills with outfields at Montblairy, Cornhill and Glendronach. It now takes in{Kirktown {of Boyndie Farm, Blackpots Farm, {Bellman Croft, Kirkhill Croft and the {'fued lands' or 'fisher riggs'} formerly allocated to the fishermen of Whitehills. The land is all arable, Grade 2. { {(There is no Grade 1 land in Scotland)
